page.title: 09Nursery & Market Garden
page.content: My father used to be a pig farmer based at Goosemoor Farm. Now another pig farmer rents the land from him. Last September he started a business growing shrubs in one acre of land. The very young plants which come to us from a factory are brought on in pots of peat and compost. They are kept in two poly tunnels, each holding 13,500 plants. After about 3 years the young shrubs are sent to the nurseries for sale to the public. Sweetcorn and strawberries are also grown and the public can come and pick their own.
